Author: Don King#8901
Content:
Can someone launch a Roubini assetchain?
could be 50% PoS , 50% Pow, verus clone
The cryptosphere would love this coin, just imagine buying coffee from Starbucks and paying in 'Doom' dollars, maybe 100 nouriels in every $Doom
Dr Doom needs a meme coin asap

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think verus has all komdo AC options.. so thats perfectly possible...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: From working with komodo code to make the streamer and staked, most of the verus stuff is already in there as far as options to enable go, but its is just a stub, that leads no where,  guess waiting for PR next election to merge back down all over verus's updates.

Author: Don King#8901
Content:
Could be a use case for staked streams, combat fake news, have all political policies, press releases, speeches etc on a blockchain for verification, stop fake news
https://www.ethnews.com/brazilian-presidential-candidate-announces-plans-for-blockchain-tech-in-government

Author: Don King#8901
Content: Could this be chain named in honour of Roubini? That dude is good for marketing

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes I envision this is what it should be used for... but I also see very quickly if it starts getting used for such things, those very people using it for horrible things, and then saying thats what and all its used for üò¶

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: I think if someone really wanted to start a 50% PoS - 50% PoW chain right now , then they could contact Verus Devs to see if it's possible to clone the Verus repo and use the komodod built from it to spawn a new chain

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you can make a 50/50 chain with komodo anyway

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Verus's implementation is just a bit diffrent

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and verusu itself is an AC of the verus komodod, so there sbsolutly nothing stopping you from just using thier binary to start a chain with diffrent parameters.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: No need to contact their devs and annoy them

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I would ot it right now, but I have more important things to do ... advice is look at the contents of the script `verusd`

Author: Don King#8901
Content: @blackjok3r , staked just needs one legit use case that shows off the tech, then it becomes just like any other tool, like a knife of hammer, can be used for good or evil. Will there be a new staked coin, or some airdrop for kmd and/or Supernet, how do you devs get compensated if staked streams go viral?

Author: Don King#8901
Content: Do you get a royalty for each staked clone?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The streaming chain itself is a new chain spawened by the creator of the stream, the notaisation of it will be paid in STAKED...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The notarisation makes it immutable

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: anyone can use hte stream withoutnotarisation for free ... of it they want, they could launch their own notaries

Author: Don King#8901
Content: Ok, so launching a staked stream is basically free, just dPoW fees?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Staked notaries subscribe to trusted oracles to fetch new chain parameters ... I dont see nefarious actors, being trusted by staked notaries, so they would need to create thei own notary network to notarise those.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: first step is to make it work ...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: until that time all we can do is guess

Author: Don King#8901
Content: Ok, I see unlimited possibilities in copyright alone, put creative work on a blockchain secured by bitcoin, then you can always proof you created music, writings, anything

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes, this was my first thaught of this, although if the creator of the content never did it first, someone could steal it, stream it to a secured chain and them try to claim ownership, so some kind of stanndard would need to be created ... or verus's work on decentalised ID's or soemthing would need to be incorperated

Author: Don King#8901
Content: Yes, would need to stream content plus identity almost immediately, very powerful tech

Author: Don King#8901
Content: Will there be airdrop, how can I buy some staked?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The fact that the chain creator, uses a public/private key they own, already incorperates some kind of ownership

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Staked emmission is still not 100% finalised.. there is already some coins that exist, but they are held in a json by alright from staked4.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The early testers will NOT be getting all their coins at the outset to stake ... as that would just amke them giant whales... and we want to avoid that happening.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Some kind of time lock on them will be applied

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The thing with staked is that it can be as many chains as we want each serving a diffrent purpose.. and you can move your staked to any chain you like. We will likey have all chains as -ac_public=1 and a single chains (likey the main chain) where private TX will be possible, to focuse the sheilded coins all into 1 chain.

Author: Don King#8901
Content: I know plenty of creatives who still use posting themselves manuscripts by registered mail as their method to prove they had a copy of some content on a specified date, staked could capture that market immediately

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Well I said contact Verus Devs because, with KMD there is implicit permission to use komodod to generate new blockchains. But if someone cloned Verus repo and made a new chain out of it, it would be more like old school fork (Ex: forking BTC code to get LTC) . Anyway a little communication never hurts üòÉ

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: open source means anyone is free to use it, the main difference is a "pure" fork (aka 'a clone') of Verus would certainly never have dPoW

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: What I meant was that you dont need to clone te repo

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you can just use the binary bundled with their agama to make a runtime fork by changing the `verusd` scripts parameters, just like you do to create a komodo runtime fork.

Author: DR3WSKi#8767
Content: @ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢ about to do a comp build and figured I should make the jump to Linux, as I c how much u like windowsüòÇ, any recommendations on learning linux? I saw a 5 day learning program tia

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: if you are a new user, first get a taste of it by install Linux in a Virtual Machine

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I'd suggest trying out Ubuntu

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: many people liked it.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Some even liked even more different varients

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: like Linux Mint

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: there are bunch others.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: The target of yours should be to get familiar with command line on linux

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: not the desktop

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: get over with your fear of doing commands if you ever have.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: learn how to edit, manage files via command line, install software or any other usual stuff you think you can/want to do via clicks on desktop, try to do the exact same via comamnd line

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: once comfortable, switch to a linux os installed in place of or beside windows.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: go easy üòâ

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: plenty of tutorials online

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: may be udemy have good ones to start with.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: or coursera

Author: Seko#7408
Content: What do you think?  Do crypto games have a future?  What will it look like?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMDICE

Author: Seko#7408
Content:
I wonder if games on Blockchain really have a future.  I'm actually sure, but I'd like to hear your opinion.

There are a lot of games on Ethereum now.  For the games to have a future, you need scaling and trust.

FIFA Ultimate on Blockchain for example, but decentralized.
 
I could imagine a simple penalty shootout game.  Every tournament participant pays into the pool and the winner gets everything minus the fees.

Author: Seko#7408
Content: In past simple penalty shootout games in flash had big success. Why not on blockchain?

Author: Seko#7408
Content: If I could program this, I'd start now.

Author: Seko#7408
Content:
Free Tokens for beginner to get new gamer.  Fun is in the foreground.

Games have always worked.  On the console, in the browser or as an app.  So why not on blockchain?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: exactly

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dice is always popular on blockchain and KMDICE uses the dice CC contract for a decentralized provably fair betting with every single bet validated

Author: Seko#7408
Content: KMDICE is the basis for infinite widths of the blockchain. The games could be so extensive and all genres could be served.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is just an example of how to do realtime games on blockchain
